comments:
I'm using Eclipse 3.2 with Callisto and MyEclipse 5M2. When I try to open a new Visual Class, the operation fails with several exceptions and the 'see log file' message:

It's possible MyEclipse may be loading in a different version of VE or other pre-req plugins (i.e. Eclipse, GEF, EMF).
Please provide the information found in your configuration so I can investigate this further (Help-->About Eclipse SDK-->Configuration Details). Just paste the information from that dialog into this bug report.

Created an attachment (id=46811)
My Configuration from Help > About Eclipse

Here is my Configuration.

JEM, VE, EMF, and GEF are installed twice. I can't tell if this is causing the problem or not. MyEclipse already installed these. Try starting from the top, reinstalling MyEclipse, and this time from Callisto DO NOT select GEF, VE, EMF, or JEM.

Created an attachment (id=46816)
Configuration after reinstall

The Help > About > Configuration after reinstalling Eclipse and MyEclipse

Created an attachment (id=46817)
Error Log after reinstall

Error log after reinstalling Eclipse and MyEclipse

I have reinstalled Eclipse and MyEclipse. This clean install did not contain the VE so I have downloaded it via Update Manager. After restart and -clean, the same exception was thrown. I have attached the config and error log.

I don't see anything wrong. Try installing just straight Eclipse 3.2 and Callisto and don't install MyEclipse. See if you get the same error then. That will tell us if it is your system or if it is MyEclipse.
I installed Eclipse and downloaded the GEF, EMF, VE. It works. I have installed MyEclipse after it and still works.

I think the case can be closed. The conclusion: Installation order matters.

> I installed Eclipse and downloaded the GEF, EMF, VE. It works. I have installed
> MyEclipse after it and still works.

Great, I'm glad it works now. 

I think I remember now from way back this occurring in the past. MyEclipse can't be installed first. I wished I had remembered that before you went through all of this. :-(
